Steps to reproduce
------------------
`HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\PowerShell-6.0.0\ProgramsMenuShortcut` is not removed on upgrade to 6.0.1

Expected behavior
-----------------
should be removed on upgrade

Actual behavior
---------------

stays

Environment data
----------------

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```powershell
> $PSVersionTable
6.0.0
```

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body: The problem is that we change the key in each package.  Changing the root doesn't fix the issue.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body:
I install and then uninstall PowerShell-6.1.0-preview.7845-win-x64.msi - the registry key was removed.

I review samples in Internet and discover that we use common pattern - nobody remove the registry key explicitly.

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body: Try the upgrade scenario.   I'll update the instruction to remove the uninstall, scenario.

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body: We can fix this by changing the key to `HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\PowerShellCore\ProgramsMenuShortcut`

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body:
I still can not repo. I install PowerShell-6.1.0-preview.7856-win-x64.msi over PowerShell-6.1.0-preview.7845-win-x64.msi  - the previous key was removed.

Our msi do uninstall previous version before install new.

title: reg key not removed on upgrade
